newsitem.title: UK: Cedardata sees year results below forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Cedardata sees year results below forecasts.

text.p: British computer software supplier Cedardata Plc said on Friday it expected results for the year ending on March 31 to be considerably below market expectations.
The firm said a number of contracts had been delayed, particularly in the public sector, and pricing had become increasingly competitive in the health sector.
However, the company said it had seen an increase in business in the commercial sector, while maintenance revenues had also increased substantially.
"The company will be taking steps to reduce overheads to a sustainable level, consistent with providing an acceptable quality of service to its customers," Cedardata said in a statement.
